awd_titl_txt: Research Initiation Award: Advancing Research on Data Analysis with High Performance Computing
awd_abstract_narration:
Research Initiation Awards provide support for junior and mid-career faculty at Historically Black Colleges and Universities who are building new research programs or redirecting and rebuilding existing research programs. It is expected that the award helps to further the faculty member's research capability and effectiveness, improves research and teaching at his home institution, and involves undergraduate students in research experiences.  The award to Prairie View A&M University has potential broader impact in a number of areas. The goal of the project is to advance big data analysis with research in high performance computing.  Source code from the project will be provided as part of a library under an open-source license in an effort to promote reproducible research within the signal-processing community. This research can have applications in areas such as homeland security, precision agriculture, and geospatial applications.  The project will also enhance the research experience and training of undergraduate students at Prairie View A&M University.  

The research goal is to advance the ability of analyzing digital data sets, including image, video, weather data, and DNA data sequence compression, with novel high performance computing (HPC) based signal processing techniques.  The project will investigate how to increase the efficiency of data analysis, including image processing, video processing, and computer visualization, in a high performance computing environment.  By efficiently integrating such technologies, the speed of the big data analysis processes will be dramatically increased and the analysis quality will be significantly improved.  The project focuses on strategies for establishing an HPC based digital signal processing system, eventually extending these algorithms and simulations to other types of data sets.
org_div_long_name: Div. of Equity for Excellence in STEM

por.por_cntn:
Today's scientists and engineers depend increasingly on information and tools made available through new advanced computing technologies. High Performance Computing (HPC) now plays a critical role in enabling such scientific and engineering inquiry. To enhance the research and teaching capability in the data analysis and HPC areas in Prairie View A&M University (PVAMU), this work was proposed to advance research on data analysis with the help of HPC technology.

The outcomes of this project can be classified in five categories: 1) State of the art deep learning algorithms were researched and developed for multiple applications, including face recognition, deep fake detection, underwater object detection, etc. The source codes are open to public upon request under an open-source license. The research results were disseminated to public through journal and conference publications, such as IEEE Access, IEEE International Conference on Image Processing, etc. 2) Underrepresented students were involved and trained in the research projects. These projects equipped our students with confidence and appropriate skills for the future diversified workforce. 3) Faculty professional development was supported in both research and teaching. By conducting the supported projects, the PI greatly advanced his research and teaching capabilities. Such professional development enables him to collaborate with other researchers and to secure future funding to support his research endeavor, which benefits underrepresented students as well as the university. 4) Computer Science curricula were enhanced in the College of Engineering. New course was developed and existing courses were revamped with integration of the research results. 5) A computer vision research and teaching laboratory was established in PVAMU. A scalable research and teaching platform was developed to support more subjects in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM).

To summarize, this NSF grant has provided substantial support which made great impact on the research and teaching capabilities at PVAMU, a historically black college and university (HBCU). Such capability improvement will help the PI to establish a sustainable research environment by securing research supports from federal funding agencies. It will further benefit our underrepresented students, our university, and our nation.

 


Last Modified: 11/30/2021
Modified by: Yonghui Wang
